item.content:encoded: One thing LLMs make you realize is how poorly many math books are written. Literally just asking the LLM for what a theorem does tells you more than many math books. So... why couldn't the author just do that?

item.content:encoded: Midnight here in Kyiv and like clockwork Russia has launched its nightly air strikes on Ukraine. Sirens wailing as I type this and mobile phones ringing with text alerts warning of ‚Äúincreased air threat‚Äù and urging to seek shelter.

item.content:encoded:
Algorithmic newsfeeds created a filter bubble that tore at the fabric of society and increased partisanship
Now, because of AI, the marginal cost of creating hyper-targeted propaganda is going to zero. Delivered to your personal newsfeed
We are in for a very bad time

item.content:encoded:
The IRS is nearing an agreement to allow immigration officials to use tax data to confirm the names and addresses of people suspected of being in the country illegally.
The IRS has for years reassured undocumented workers that their tax info is confidential and that it's safe to
item.author: Kyle Griffin

item.content:encoded:
When Tesla was on the verge of bankruptcy, Musk got $465 million from the feds.
When SpaceX was on the verge of bankruptcy, Musk won a $1.6 billion contract from NASA.
When the average Joe gets diagnosed with cancer he has a 42% chance of going bankrupt.
That must change.
